DETAILS: This is to inform you that based on the recommendations of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee, the Board of Directors, at its meeting held today, has approved the appointment of Dr Pradeep Kumar Khosla as an Additional Director and re-appointment as a Non-Executive Independent Director for a second consecutive term of 5 years from January 11, 2023 up to January 10, 2028, subject to approval of the Members. Dr Pradeep Kumar Khosla has not been debarred from holding office of Director by virtue of any Order passed by Securities and Exchange Board of India or any other authority. SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: This is to inform you that the Board of Directors has, at its meeting held today, based on the recommendations of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee and subject to approval of the shareholders, approved the re-appointment of:1. Mr. Rajesh Gopinathan as Chief Executive Officer and Managing Director for a term of five years from February 21, 2022 to February 20, 2027. 2. Mr. N Ganapathy Subramaniam as Chief Operating Officer and Executive Director from February 21, 2022 to May 19, 2024, as per the retirement age policy of the Company.  Mr. Subramaniam is the brother of Mr. N. Chandrasekaran. Mr. Rajesh Gopinathan and Mr. N Ganapathy Subramaniam are not debarred from holding the office of Director by virtue of any order of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) or any other such authority.

DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Pursuant to Regulation 30 of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, the Company had on January 4, 2020, informed the stock exchange regarding the appeal filed by the Company in the Hon ble Supreme Court of India on January 3, 2020 (i) to set aside the Judgement dated December 18, 2019 in the case of  Cyrus Investments Pvt. Ltd. & Anr. v. Tata Sons Ltd. & Ors.  (Company Appeal No. 254 of 2018) and  Cyrus Pallonji Mistry v. Tata Sons Ltd. & Ors.  (Company Appeal No. 268 of 2018) which has directed reinstatement of Mr. Cyrus Pallonji Mistry as Director of the Company for rest of the tenure and (ii) in the interim stay on operation of the said Judgement to the extent it relates to the Company.The Hon ble Supreme Court of India has, vide its order dated January 10, 2020, granted a stay on the operation of the said Judgement and had posted the matter for detailed hearing at a later date.'.

SUBJECT: Buyback
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on June 15, 2018 has approved a proposal to buyback up to 7,61,90,476 Equity Shares (Seven crore sixty one lakh ninety thousand four hundred and seventy six only) of the Company for an aggregate amount not exceeding Rs 16,000 crore (Rupees sixteen thousand crore only) (hereinafter referred to as the "Buyback Size") being 1.99% of the total paid up equity share capital, at Rs 2,100 (Rupees two thousand one hundred only) per Equity Share (hereinafter referred to as the "Buyback Price").

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Further to our intimation dated June 12, 2018 and in terms of Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, we wish to inform you that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held today at 11.00 a.m. and concluded at  2.35 p.m. has approved a proposal to buyback up to 7,61,90,476 Equity Shares (Seven crore sixty one lakh ninety thousand four hundred and seventy six only) of the Company for an aggregate amount not exceeding Rs. 16,000 crore (Rupees sixteen thousand crore only) (hereinafter referred to as the ￂﾓBuyback Sizeￂﾔ) being 1.99% of the total paid up equity share capital, at Rs. 2,100  (Rupees two thousand one hundred only) per Equity Share (hereinafter referred to as the ￂﾓBuyback Priceￂﾔ).

We request you to kindly take on record the above.

SUBJECT: Appointment of Auditors
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that Pursuant to Section 139 of the Companies Act, 2013 and Rules made thereunder, it is mandatory for the Company to rotate the current statutory auditors on completion of a maximum term permitted under the said Section. Accordingly, based on the proposal of the Audit Committee of the Company, the Board has, at its meeting held on February 20, 2017, recommended the appointment of B S R & Co. LLP, Chartered Accountants (Firm Registration No. 101248W/W - 100022) as the statutory auditors of the Company. B S R & Co. LLP will hold the office for a period of 5 (five) consecutive years from the conclusion of the Annual General Meeting of the Company scheduled to be held in the year 2017 till the conclusion of the Annual General Meeting to be held in the year 2022, subject to the approval of shareholders of the Company. Further, based on the proposal of the Audit Committee of the Company, the Board has appointed KPMG India, Chartered Accountants, to audit the financial statements under the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) for a period of five financial years (FY) from FY2017-18 to FY2021-22.

SUBJECT: Buyback
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on February 20, 2017 has approved a proposal to buyback up to 5,61,40,351 Equity Shares (Five crore sixty one lakh forty thousand three hundred and fifty one only) of the Company for an aggregate amount not exceeding 16,000 crore ( Rupees Sixteen thousand crore only) (hereinafter referred to as the "Buyback Size") being 2.85% of the total paid up equity share capital, at 2,850 (Rupees Two thousand eight hundred and fifty only) per Equity Share (hereinafter referred to as the "Buyback Price"). The buyback is proposed to be made from the shareholders of the Company on a proportionate basis under the tender offer route using the stock exchange mechanism in accordance with the provisions contained in the SEBI (Buy Back of Securities) Regulations, 1998 (hereinafter referred to as the "Buyback Regulations") and the Companies Act, 2013 and rules made thereunder.

SUBJECT: Reply to Clarification Sought
DETAILS: The Exchange has sought clarification with reference to company letter dated November 10, 2016, informing the Exchange regarding nominating Mr. Ishaat Hussain as the Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Company in place of Mr. Cyrus P. Mistry with immediate effect and that Mr. Hussain shall hold office as Chairman of the Company until a new Chairman is appointed in his place. 1. In the letter cited at the para 1, it is stated that  The Company has received a letter dated November 9, 2016 from Tata Sons Limited nominating Mr. Ishaat Hussain as the Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Company in place of Mr. Cyrus P. Mistry with immediate effect  which implies that the decision of replacement of chairman was taken by Tata Sons Limited (Shareholder). Kindly let us know the provision of the Law/Articles of Association that empowers shareholders to appoint or remove chairman of the Board. 2. Kindly clarify whether removal of Mr. Cyrus P Mistry as Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Company and appointment of Mr. Hussain as the new Chairman of the Company was approved by the Board of Directors of Tata Consultancy Services Limited and if so, on which date did the Board meet for this purpose. The Company has replied as: Article 90 of the Articles of Association ( AOA ) of the Company empowers Tata Sons Limited ( Tata Sons ) to nominate the Chairman of the Board of Directors, so long as Tata Sons along with its associates holds at least 26% of the paid up equity share capital of the Company. In exercise of the powers under Article 90, Tata Sons Limited, vide its letter dated November 09, 2016, has nominated Mr. Ishaat Hussain as the Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Company in place of Mr.Cyrus P. Mistry. The provisions of the AOA are binding on the Company   The copy of the reply is enclosed.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange regarding the following material events:1. The Company has received a letter dated November 9, 2016 from Tata Sons Limited nominating Mr. Ishaat Hussain as the Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Company in place of Mr. Cyrus P. Mistry with immediate effect. In view of this, Mr. Mistry has ceased to be the Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Company and Mr. Hussain is the new Chairman of the Company. The Company has been further informed that Mr. Hussain shall hold office as Chairman of the Company until a new Chairman is appointed in his place. 2. Tata Sons Limited has issued a special notice under Section 169 read with Section 115 of the Companies Act, 2013 and a requisition for convening an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders of the Company under Section 100(2) of the Companies Act, 2013 to consider a resolution for the removal of Mr. Cyrus P. Mistry as Director of the Company.

DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that As per Ministry of Corporate Affairs notification dated February 16, 2015, listed and unlisted companies with net worth of Rs 500 crore or more including the parent or subsidiaries of such companies will have to prepare their financial statements following Ind AS with effect from April 1, 2016 with comparative periods beginning April 1, 2015. Therefore, the Company will be publishing its financial statements prepared under Ind AS when it announces its Q1 earnings for FY17 on July 14, 2016 and not as per Indian GAAP. The Company will continue to post its earnings in IFRS as well. Further the Company has submitted a copy of self-explanatory document titled "Adoption of Ind AS".

DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that that the Hon'ble High Court of judicature at Bombay has sanctioned the Scheme of Amalgamation between CMC Limited (CMC or Transferor Company) and Tata Consultancy Services Limited (TCS or Transferee Company) on August 14, 2015 with respect to petition filed by TCS.Further, the Hon'ble High Court of judicature at Hyderabad for the states of Telangana and Andhra Pradesh had sanctioned the Scheme on July 20, 2015 with respect to petition filed by CMC.Pursuant to Clause 3.1.9 of the Scheme, TCS has fixed October 01, 2015 as the Record Date to determine the names of the public shareholders of CMC (i.e. shareholders other than TCS) who would be entitled to receive the equity shares of TCS in lieu of equity shares held in CMC.Pursuant to clause 11.2 of the Scheme, 79 (seventy nine) equity shares of Rs. 1 each of TCS will be issued and allotted as fully paid up equity shares for every 100 (one hundred) equity shares of Rs. 10 each held by the public shareholders of CMC, whose names appear in the Register of Members of CMC and whose names appear as the beneficial owners of the equity shares of CMC in the records of the depositories (or to such of their respective heirs, executors, administrators or other legal representatives or other successors in the title as may be recognised by the Board of Directors of TCS) on the Record Date.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange has sought clarification from Tata Consultancy Services Limited with respect to recent news item captioned "TCS Sees digital services as over $5b opportunity". In this regard, Exchange have advised the Company to provide clarification/confirmation on the news item in detail including the following:   a) Whether such event/negotiations/article stated in published news were taking place? If so, you are advised to provide the said information along with the sequence of events in chronological order and the material impact of this article on the Company.   b) Whether company are aware of any information that has not been announced to the Exchanges under clause 36 of the Listing Agreement.  The response from the Company is awaited.

SUBJECT: Scheme of Arrangement
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that the Audit Committee of the Company at its meeting held on October 16, 2014 have furnished their Report recommending the Scheme of Amalgamation of CMC Limited (CMC) with the Company (Scheme) formulated under sections 391-394 and other applicable provisions, if any, of the Companies Act, 1956 or any statutory modifications, re-enactments or amendments thereof from time to time. The Boards of the Company and of its subsidiary, CMC at their respective meetings held on October 16, 2014 have approved the Scheme.    As per the terms of the Scheme, shareholders of CMC (other than TCS) will receive 79 equity share(s) of Re. 1 each of TCS for every 100 equity share(s) of Rs. 10 each of CMC held by them. The Swap Ratio has been arrived at based on the valuation report prepared by B.S.R. & Associates LLP.    The appointed date for the proposed Scheme is April 1, 2015. The Scheme is subject to sanction of the Hon'ble High Courts and all other statutory approvals as may be required under law.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that "TCS has filed a settlement with the Court, in a Class Action Law Suit pending in U.S. District Court, California Northern District, for approval of the Court. This settlement involves the payment of, in all inclusive, settlement amount of USD 29.75 million by TCS. The settlement is made without admitting any wrong doing by TCS. This settlement is subject to fairness review and approval by the Court and settlement will not become effective until and unless approval by the Court is given. TCS believes that it has always acted appropriately notwithstanding the allegations in the case. The Company has admitted no wrong doing and none has been found by the Court. It agreed to settle this matter to eliminate any ongoing distraction to its associates and the Management".

SUBJECT: Increase in authorised share capital/others
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that : "Pursuant to the approval of the shareholders by way of a Postal Ballot, results of which were announced on March 21, 2008 : 1) the authorized Share capital of our Company has increased from Rs.120,00,00,000/- (Rupees One Hundred and Twenty Crores only) divided into 120,00,00,000 (One Hundred and Twenty Crores) equity shares of Re. 1/- (Rupee One only) each to Rs. 220,00,00,000/- (Rupees Two Hundred and Twenty Crores only) divided into 120,00,00,000 (One Hundred and Twenty Crores) Equity Shares of Re. 1/- (Rupee One Only) each and 100,00,00,000 (One Hundred Crores) Redeemable Preference Shares of Re. 1/- (Rupee One only) each. 2) a Committee of Directors has, on March 28, 2008 allotted all the 100,00,00,000 Redeemable Preference Shares of the Company of Re. 1/- each at par to Tata Sons Limited. The said Redeemable Preference Shares shall be entitled to a fixed cumulative dividend of 1% per annum and a variable non-cumulative dividend of 1% of the difference between the rate of dividend declared during the year on the Equity Shares of the Company and the average rate of dividend declared on the Equity Shares of the Company for the three years preceding the year of issue of the said Redeemable Preference Shares. The other rights attached to the Redeemable Preference Shares are as contained in Article 5A, which has been approved for insertion vide Resolution No. 2 of the postal Ballot Notice dated January 24, 2008. The said Redeemable Preference Shares are not being listed on any Stock Exchange."

SUBJECT: Reg.7(3) of SEBI (Substantial Acq of shares &Takeovers),1997
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has submitted to the Exchange a copy of a letter from Tata Chemicals Limited (Tata Chem) dated February 27, 2008 intimating about the sale of equity shares of the Company (Tata Consultancy Services Limited) by Tata Chem, Navajbai Ratan Tata Trust (NRTT), Jamsetji Tata Trust (JTT) and Tata Sons Limited (TSL), which they have advised to the Company and the Stock Exchanges may be treated as a disclosure under Regulation 7(1A) of the SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 1997, if applicable. The said letter contains disclosure of movement of the shareholding of Tata Chem, NRTT, JTT and TSL between January 24, 2008 (the date of the last disclosure under Regulation 8(2) ) and February 26, 2008 as well as between October 22, 2007 (the date of the last disclosure under Regulation 7(1A) ) and February 26, 2008. All the sale transaction were through open market. The paid-up equity capital of Tata Consultancy Services Limited over the above period was Rs.97,86,10,498/-. This disclosure by the Company may be treated as compliance with Regulation 7(3) of SEBI (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 1997, if applicable. Further, the details of Shareholding of Tata Chemicals Limited in Tata Consultancy Services Limited is as follows: 1) Shareholding in TCS Ltd. as on January 24, 2008 - 23,07,550; 2) Shares sold since January 25, 2008 - 13,17,006; 3) Shareholding in TCS Ltd. as on February 26, 2008 - 9,90,544. Details of shares sold by Tata Chemicals Ltd. from January 25,2008 to February 26, 2008: i) February 21, 2008 - 71,896 Nos.; ii) February 22, 2008 - 5,110 Nos.; iii) February 25, 2008 - 5,05,000 Nos.; iv) February 26, 2008 - 7,35,000 Nos. Total - 13,17,006 Nos. The details of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here.

SUBJECT: Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that pursuant to Section 192A(2) of the Companies Act, 1956 read with the Companies (Passing of the Resolution by Postal Ballot) Rules, 2001, the following resolution are proposed to be passed as Ordinary/Special Resolution as the case may be by way of Postal Ballot. (1) Ordinary Resolution for increase in the Authorised Share Capital and Alteration of the Memorandum of Association of the Company. (2) Special Resolution for Alteration of the Articles of Association of the Company. (3) Special Resolution for Issue of Redeemable Preference shares. The company has appointed Ms. Shirin Bharucha, Legal Advisor, as the Scrutinizer for conducting the Postal Ballot process in a fair and transparent manner. The duly completed forms should reach Scrutinizer not later than the close of working hours on March 17, 2008. Upon completion of the scrutiny of the Forms, the Scrutinizer will submit her report to the Chairman. The result of the Postal Ballot will be announced by a Director of the Company on March 21, 2008. A copy of the postal ballot notice shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). SUBJECT: Issue And Allotment of Preference Shares
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange Vide its letter dated January 16, 2008 that "At a meeting of the Board of Directors of the Company held today, the Board has approved of a proposal to issue and allot non-convertible redeemable preference shares upto an aggregate nominal value of Rs.100 crores (Rupees One Hundred Crores) to the promoters of the Company, Tata Sons Limited, subject to the approval of shareholders. The exact terms and conditions of the preference shares shall be decided by a Committee of the Board of Directors. Accordingly, the Board has also proposed to amend the Memorandum and Articles of Association of the Company to amend and increase the authorised capital of the Company as also to insert the terms of the preference shares in the Articles of Association. The approval of the shareholders for the aforesaid issue of preference shares is sought to be taken by postal ballot. The postal ballot notice together with the explanatory statement shall be sent to the shareholders in due course".

SUBJECT: Memorandum of Understanding
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that: "Tata Consultancy Services Limited (TCS) and Tata Realty And Infrastructure Limited (TRIL) have entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) under which TCS proposes to commission TRIL to develop for TCS properties on land owned / to be owned by TCS. The MoU covers eight properties located at Pune, Trivandrum, Kochi, Ahmedabad, Hyderabad, Kolkata, Nagpur and Mangalore totaling approx. 380 acres acquired / to be acquired by TCS. The properties will be developed in a phased manner over the next few years for TCS. The buildings will be constructed and owned by TRIL (or by Special Purpose Vehicles set up by TRIL) and will be leased to TCS. TCS is one of the world's leading information technology companies engaged in the business of software development and allied businesses. TRIL is engaged in the business of, inter alia, development of real estate and infrastructural facilities. TCS and TRIL are both promoted by, and are subsidiaries of Tata Sons Limited".

SUBJECT: Appointment
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that at a meeting of the Board of Directors of the Company held on November 02,2006, the Directors have appointed Mrs. Laura M. Cha on the Board of the Company as an Independent Director. Mrs. Cha is a member of the Executive Council of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government and Non-Executive Chairman of HSBC Investment Asia Holdings Limited. She is also Vice Chairman of the International Advisory Council of the China Securities Regulatory Commission and Senior Advisor to Investor AB, a Swedish conglomerate. Mrs. Cha, apart from being an Independent Non-Executive Director of certain listed companies is also a Non-Executive Director of the Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited and of Bank of Communications. She is a member of the International Council of the Asia Society in New York. Mrs. Cha has been awarded a Silver Bauhinia Star in 2001 by the Hong Kong Government for her public service.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that the Regional Provident Fund Commissioner ("RPFC") had in the past issued an Order covering the erstwhile TCS Division under the Employees' Provident Fund and Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952 (the "PF Act") as an establishment rendering "expert services" in terms of a Notification issued by the Central Government in May 1971. A Writ Petition challenging this Order of the RPFC was filed by the Company before the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Bombay. The provision made by the Company in its books on this score aggregates Rs.47.8 crores as on September 30,2006. The company has further informed the Exchange that the Bombay High Court has, vide its Order dated September 20,2006, issued on October 05,2006, decided the case in favour of the Company and has held that the Company is not covered under the PF Act as an establishment rendering "expert services" in terms of the May 1971 Notification. The Company has its own Provident Fund which is recognized under the Income Tax Act, 1961, and its employees are members of the same. Pursuant to a Notification of the Central Government dated July 27,2006, which specifically covers the Information Technology industry under the PF Act, the Company is seeking from the Provident Fund authorities, coverage and exemption to its existing Provident Fund under the PF Act.

SUBJECT: Appointment of Directors
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that at a meeting of the Board of Directors of the Company held on September 05, 2006, the Directors have appointed Dr. Ron Sommer on the Board of the Company as an Independent Director. Dr. Ron Sommer has a PhD in Mathematics from the University of Vienna. Dr. Sommer has in the past been Chairman of the Board of Management of Deutsche Telekom AG, (Germany) and at present is :- (i) Member of the Supervisory Board of Munich Re (Germany). (ii) Chairman of the Advisory Board and Director of AFK Systema (Russia). (iii) Member of the International Advisory Board of Blackstone Group(USA). (iv) Member of the Advisory Board of Celanese AG (Germany). (v) Director of Motorola Inc.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that it has been reported in some sections of the media in the USA that a class action suit has been filed against TCS by one of its employees in a California Court alleging violation of employment laws. TCS has so far not been served with any papers in the alleged suit. TCS therefore has had no opportunity to examine the veracity of the allegation made. TCS is surprised at the allegation since it has been legally advised that it is fully compliant with all the applicable federal and state laws in all the jurisdiction where it operates. All TCS employees in the United States are paid their remuneration in accordance with the terms of their employment contracts, which are fully complaint with the applicable employment laws. Company will appropriately and adequately respond to any legal proceeding in this regard as and when it is formally served.

The details of the press release shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited had informed the Exchange that at the board meeting of the company held on July 15,2005,the directors had approved, inter alia,a Scheme of Amalgamation with TCS of the following three unlisted wholly-owned subsidiaries of TCS: a)Airline Financial Support Services(India)Limited, Mumbai; b)Aviation Software development Consultancy India Limited, Chennai and c)TCS Business Transformation Solutions Limited, Bangalore. The company has now informed that upon approval of the Scheme by the Honourable High Courts of Judicature at Bombay,Madras and Karnataka,the Scheme will be effective retrospectively from April 01,2005.

SUBJECT: Joint Venture
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that Tata Consultancy Services Limited(TCS) has on January 16,2006 entered into a joint venture agreement with the Madhya Pradesh State Electronic Development Corporation Ltd., a wholly owned corporation of the Government of Madhya Pradesh, to set up a joint venture company(JVC) for the development, maintenance and management of a portal for providing e-governance services to the citizens of Madhya Pradesh. TCS will own 89% of the equity capital of the JVC. The board of TCS has approved of an investment of upto Rs.6.3 crore in the JVC by way of equity and/or debt.

DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that at the Board Meeting held on January 12, 2006 the Directors have declared a Third Interim Dividend of Rs.3.00 per equity share of Re.1/- each of the Company.

SUBJECT: Clarification of News
DETAILS: Clarification of News : The press had reports that the board of directors of Tata Consultancy Services Limited is expected to meet in December-end or January next to consider  bonus issue. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the press and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Tata Consultancy Services Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "We wish to state that this news item is speculative and without any basis. There is no proposal before the Directors for the issue of bonus shares".

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation/Arrangement/Merger
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that at the Board Meeting of Tata Consultancy Services Limited(TCS) held on July 15, 2005, the board of directors have approved the following two Schemes of Amalgamation pursuant to Sections 391 to 394 of the Companies Act, 1956: 1) Amalgamation of Tata Infotech Ltd. with.(TCS). The share exchange ratio for this is proposed at 1 equity share of Re.1/- each of TCS for every 2 equity shares of Rs.10/- each of Tata Infotech Limited. 2) Amalgamation with TCS of the following three unlisted wholly-owned subsidiaries of TCS: a) Airline Financial Support Services (India) Limited; b) Aviation Software Development Consultancy India Limited; c) TCS Business Transformation Solutions Limited. since the companies at a), b) and c) above are wholly-owned subsidiaries of TCS, no new shares will be issued upon the amalgamation becoming effective. The Schemes of Amalgamation will be subject to all statutory approvals as required under law.

SUBJECT: AGM/Book Closure
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that AGM of the Company will be held on July 19, 2005. The Board of Directors of the Company has proposed final dividend of 500% (Rs. 5/- per equity share of par value of Re. 1/- ). For the purpose of payment of the final dividend, the Register of Members and Share Transfer books of the Company will remain closed from July 08, 2005 to July 19, 2005 (both days inclusive). The final dividend as recommended by the Board of Directors, if declared, would be paid to such shareholders whose names appear in the Register of Members as on July 19, 2005. In respect of shares held in electronic mode, the dividend wil be paid on the basis of beneficial ownership of the shares as per details to be furnished by National Securities Depository Limited and Central Depository Services (India) Limited as at the end of business hours on July 07, 2005.

SUBJECT: Clarification of News
DETAILS: Clarification of News : The media had reports that Tata Consultancy Services Limited might announce an acquisition shortly. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Tata Consultancy Services Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "We wish to confirm that there is no basis to the market reports that the Company might announce an acquisition shortly".

SUBJECT: Dividend/Others
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that the directors have recommended a final dividend of Rs.5/- per equity share of Re.1/- each of the company for approval by the shareholders of the company at the forthcoming AGM of the company. This would be in addition to the first interim dividend of Rs.3.00 per share and the second interim dividend of Rs.3.50 per share paid during the year. The company has further informed that the company's wholly owned subsidiary in Sweden, Tata Consultancy Services Sverige AB, will be acquiring 100% a stake in Swedish IT Resources AB('SITAR'),a sales and marketing partner of the company in Sweden.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that with regards to the news item titled 'TCS may get Rs.318/- crore e-governance project" appearing in the Business Line on December 09, 2004, the Company has clarified that while discussions and negotiations on the e-governance project of the Ministry of Company Affairs are ongoing with the Ministry, the same have not yet concluded. The Company has further stated that since the matter is still under negotiation, it would not be appropriate for the Company to comment on the value and scope of the contract and the state of the negotiations. If and when the contract is finalized, the Company shall intimate the stock Exchanges about the same and shall also make appropriate Press Releases".

SUBJECT: Interim Dividend
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that at the Board Meeting held on October 21, 2004 the board declared an Interim Dividend of Rs.3 (Rupees Three only) per equity share of Re.1/- each of the company and the same will be paid to the shareholders of the Company whose names appear in the Register of Members of the Company or in the record of the depositories as beneficial owners of the shares as on October 29, 2004 which is record date fixed for the purpose.

SUBJECT: Record Date
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that the record date for determining the beneficial owners to whom the interim dividend, if declared, will be paid shall be October 29, 2004.

SUBJECT: Allotment of shares
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the approval of the shareholders of the Company by way of Postal Ballot for offer, issue and allotment of shares under an Employee Share Purchase Scheme, allotment of 1827400 equity shares of Re.1/- each has been made on September 29, 2004.

SUBJECT: Results of Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Tata Consultancy Services Limited has informed the Exchange that the results of the Postal Ballot conducted by it pursuant to the Notice to the shareholders dated August 23, 2004 were announced by the Managing Director of the Company on September 28, 2004. The results are as under: 1) Special Resolution to accord the consent of the Company to the Employee Share Purchase Scheme ("ESPS") under the SEBI (Employee Stock Option Scheme and Employees Stock Purchase Scheme) Guidelines, 1999 and to offer and issue Equity Shares of the Company to select employees of the Company under the ESPS. - Special Resolution passed with the requisite majority. 2) Special Resolution to accord the consent of the Company for the offer and issuance of Equity Shares of the Company by way of Employee Share Purchase Scheme ("ESPS") under the SEBI (Employee Stock Option Scheme and Employee Stock Purchase Scheme) Guidelines, 1999 to select employees of its subsidiaries - Special Resolution passed with the requisite majority. 3) Special Resolution to accord the consent of the Company to issue of Equity Shares of the Company in accordance with the provisions of sub-section (a) of Section 81 (1A) of the Companies Act, 1956 by way of Employee Share Purchase Scheme ("ESPS") under the SEBI (Employee Stock Option Scheme and Employee Stock Purchase Scheme) Guidelines, 1999 to select employees of the Company and its subsidiaries - Special Resolution passed with the requisite majority.
